com.madrobot.io.net
Class PeerDiscovery

java.lang.Object
  com.madrobot.io.net.PeerDiscovery

public class PeerDiscovery
extends java.lang.Object

Performs broadcast and multicast peer detection.

Usage {@code int group = 6969; PeerDiscovery mp = new PeerDiscovery(group, 6969); Peer[] peers = mp.getPeers(100, (byte) 0); System.out.println(peers.length + " peers found"); for(Peer p : peers) System.out.println("\t" + p);

Field Detail

group

public final int group
The group identifier. Determines the set of peers that are able to discover each other

port

public final int port
The port number that we operate on

Data returned with discovery

Constructor Detail

PeerDiscovery

public PeerDiscovery(int group,
                     int port)
              throws java.io.IOException
Constructs a UDP broadcast-based peer

Parameters:
group - The identifier shared by the peers that will be discovered.
port - a valid port, i.e.: in the range 1025 to 65535 inclusive
Throws:
java.io.IOException
Method Detail

disconnect

public void disconnect()
Signals this PeerDiscovery to shut down. This call will block until everything's timed out and closed etc.

getPeers

public PeerDiscovery.Peer[] getPeers(int timeout,
                                     byte peerType)
                              throws java.io.IOException
Queries the network and finds the addresses of other peers in the same group

Parameters:
timeout - How long to wait for responses, in milliseconds. Call will block for this long, although you can Thread.interrupt() to cut the wait short
peerType - The type flag of the peers to look for
Returns:
The addresses of other peers in the group
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If something goes wrong when sending the query packet

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Parameters:
args -
